newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: German denies molesting teenage Filipino boys.
newsitem.headline: German denies molesting teenage Filipino boys.

text.p: A German engineer on Thursday denied sexually molesting two teenaged Filipino boys in the latest prosecution aimed at stamping out child abuse in the Philippines.
"Not guilty," Konrad Heinrich Jecht, 63, of Munich said after a clerk read out charges against him in a court in the town of Malolos in Bulacan province, just north of Manila.
Jecht faces three counts of child abuse for his alleged fondling of the private parts of two boys aged 16 and 15.
Court documents said Jecht committed the acts twice in August on the 16-year-old and once in the same month on the younger boy.
None of the alleged victims was present in court.
The 16-year-old said in a sworn statement that Jecht offered him 150 pesos ($5.75) to go with him to Jecht's room in Bulacan and the German had just undressed him when police arrived.

Philippine courts earlier convicted an Australian and a Briton of sexually molesting Filipino children and sentenced them to 17 years in jail each, part of a crackdown to eradicate the country's image as a haven for paedophiles.

The judge who sent Briton Steven Roy Mitchell to jail last month for having sex with two brothers aged eight and four said the verdict should warn foreigners that "this country can no longer be made their playground for illegal activities, like paedophilia and child abuse".
Jecht is in police custody. His trial opens later this month.
